result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Adam Chambers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent (2nd+ offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Adam Chambers

records.addlTxt: Amendment to count 9 - St. Croix County Case #

10:55 AM Defendant Timothy Adam Chambers appeared by video from Correctional Institute along with  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen by video for Timothy Adam Chambers.   Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advises Mr. Chambers of right to appear personally.  Mr. Chambers and Atty Petersen agrees to conduct the hearing in this fashion.  On 12/22 Mr. Chambers appeared and counsel explained there is 3 counties to be wrapped up in sentencing of resolution of Mr. Chamber's various cases in 3 jurisdictions.  He plead to the Pepin Co. matters here.  The recommendation of all 3 was capped at 5 year sentence with 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES Pepin Co. case restitution for squad car of $1000 + $100 restitution surcharge to Pepin County.  Mr. Seifert also acting on behalf of Buffalo & St. Croix Co. with recommendation and sentencing separate on counts 6 & 9?  It is all wrapped up together with 5 yrs for all 3 counties.  Other sentences concurrent?  That's the State's understanding. Court reading Doc. 21 sentencing memorandum in file of Ms. Petersen.  Atty Petersen - Buffalo Co. recommendation was 2 yrs ES rather than 3.  Agreement on jail credit for 174 days for Pepin Co.; 308 days Buffalo; 252 for St. Croix Co.  Concurrent to his sentence in Pierce Co. as well.  State agrees.  Individual days credit.  Court - 8/29/22 Mr. Chambers sentenced to 5 yrs. 3 yrs IC; 3 yrs ES in 21CF261, is that the case concurrent with Mr. Seifert?  Yes.  Atty Petersen - There is a note 21CF169 case, 21CF188, 21CF261 all running concurrent.  He got 9 mos jail in 21CM205, 21TR1005.  All prison sentences concurrent.  Attorney Petersen's sentencing arguments and ask court to adopt the joint agreement.  Defendant agrees with the agreement.  Court order as to all counts other than Buffalo Co. count, Pepin & St. Croix 5 yrs prison; 2 yrs IC; 3 yrs ES; restitution Pepin Co. $1000 + 10% restitution surcharge; Buffalo Co.  4 yrs; 2 yrs IC; 2 yrs ES; all matters concurrent to each other and concurrent to Pierce 21CF188, 261, 169 concurrent to 21CM205 and 21TR1005.   Credit in the Pepin Co. count for 174 days; 308 days Buffalo Co. count and 252 on St. Croix count.  Court reviews WEDC. 
 Not eligible for CIP; eligible for SAP.  Court advises of right to appeal.  21CF196 concurrent.
Sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:08 AM Defendant Timothy Adam Chambers does not appear.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by video for Timothy Adam Chambers.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  VWC informs the Court, she contacted the Pierce County Jail and he was transported to prison today.  Attorney Petersen was not aware he was moved today and request a new date to allow time for Dodge to arrange it.  Clerk to send a notice to Dodge.  Attorney Petersen will follow up with Dodge as well.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter to the Court regarding sentencing 8-30-22
Judgment of Dismissal - DRI Counts 3,4,5,7,8,10,11,12

11:03 AM Defendant Timothy Adam Chambers appeared by zoom technology by video from the Pierce County Jail with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. We attempt to resolve 3 cases from 3 different counties.  The application for consolidation was filed Buffalo Co. case 21CF124, 2nd degree reckless endangering safety  Doc. #16 in court file.  Restitution $1000 + surcharges.  2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES.  Buffalo Co. conditions of ES no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without physician's prescription.  St. Croix Co. matter recommendation, 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES.  Plea to take & drive w/o owners consent.  21CF940 and uncharged case 21SC2597 DRI for purposes of sentencing & restitution.  St. Croix no contact with CD, HB, victims; AODA assessment & follow through; absolute sobriety; counseling.  All 3 counties be concurrent and not consecutive.  Atty Petersen informs the PLQ agreement has it layed out.  Court advises of right to PH.  Defendant waives right to PH KV.  Court reviews the Pepin Co. charges/max. penalties with defendant.  Advised of count 6 for Buffalo Co./max. penalties and right to PH to count 6.  Defendant KVI waives right to PH.  Advised of count 9 for St. Croix Co./max. penalties and right to PH to count 9.  Defendant KVI waives right to PH.  Court reviews right to appear personally and constitutional rights and felony prohibitions with defendant.  Atty Petersen agrees factual basis for plea.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1, found guilty to count 1 in the Information Doc #22.  Count 2 defendant pleads no contest, found guilty.  Count 6 defendant pleads no contest, found guilty. Count 9 defendant pleads no contest, found guilty.  Court will DRI the remaining counts in the Information.  Atty Petersen thought a PSI was requested by St. Croix.  Mr. Seifert don't think need PSI, all 3 counties capped the recommendation unless Ms. Petersen is asking for one.  Atty Petersen is not asking for one nor her client and ask the court adopt the recommendation all 3 county DA's and the defense negotiated.  Defendant would like to be sentenced close to his 8/29 Pierce Co. sentencing date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
On the record
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachments
Proposed Order for Restitution

01:38 PM Defendant Timothy Adam Chambers appeared by zoom technology by video means from the Pierce County Jail with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  We would like to continue the WOPH as we are in the middle of negotiations and by the next hearing would know how Mr. Chambers wishes to move forward.  Time limits continued to be waived for PH.  Mr. Chambers believes he will be incarcerated at the Pierce County Jail for the next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:03 PM Defendant Timothy Adam Chambers appeared by zoom technology by video means from the Pierce County Jail with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen by video means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties.  Advises of constitutional rights.  Attorney Petersen waives the time limits at this time and schedule out a month on where at with his cases in other counties.  Defendant does not object.  Court finds Mr. Chambers knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waives time limits for PH.  Mr. Chambers currently on cash bond in Pierce Co.  If released, mailing address 126 State Street, Hastings, MN  55033.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
